abilitygroupdescription.p: Magic abilities involve the use of the characters magic pool and are only available to certain archetypes.

abilitydescription.p: Augury involves petitioning a deity or powerful being for information or insight. Augurys are performed by interpretation of the stars, palmistry, tea leaf reading, dream interpretation, use of cards, the entrails of a sacraficial victim etc. The character should choose one method per message recipient and use that method thereafter.
The augury process follows the following steps. First, the character asks a question, then they prepare the augury, and finally they examine the auspicies for the answer.

When asking the question it is important that the augure specify to whom they are directing their question otherwise nameless eavesdroppers may respond. Asking the question is usually done in one of the old languages. Firstly because it may be easier to communicate to the entity in that language, and second because it makes for good theatre.
The steps to prepare an augury depend on the method of divination, but could include making a cup of tea, or sacrificing someone on an alter (players should not do this).

Finally, the auspices can be examined. The GM will answer the characters question in a three words or less or provide no response. If the augury is unsuccessful those worfs may have nothing to do with the question being asked. The player gets to see their roll, but does not know the difficulty of the augury.
It is important to know that in Malleus Deum the Gods are capricious,are not omniscient or in general, particularly caring. So they may not answer the characters augury.
A character may keep performing auguries until they fail, at which point they feel they have lost the attention of the god.

leveldescription.p: The character may be gifted with visions from their deity.

abilitydescription.p: The character knows how to make magical potions given a lab, time and the right ingredients.
The character knows how to make magical scrolls given sufficent time, and writing materials.

The caster attempts to curse the target, if successful the target gains a Hunger for Gold aspect with a difficulty equal to the magic pool result minus the targets willpower. This spell requires some item of contagion with the target in order to cast, preferably blood or hair (other items may be used with penalties to the check).

If an overcharge occurs one or more of the following occur:
The caster suffers from backlash and also gains the Hunger for Gold aspect,
A minor demon of greed takes notice and projects a simularcrum of themselves to the casters location. The goal of the demon may be to fight the caster, make a deal with the caster either for mutual benefit or by threat.
The spell nearly gets away from the caster and they must attempt assert control of the magical energies. Reroll any remaining dice used in the check and lose any dice with a face value of 1.
Roll on the magical overcharge table.

The caster designates a volume of space no larger than a typical living room. Movement within that region results in the caster receiving a short sharp shock of thaumaturgical energy, informing them of that movement and waking them if they are asleep.
The caster kisses a target on the lips and then casts this spell. Casting is close to instantaneous but the spell cannot be used in combat due to the difficulty of kissing people while in a fight.

When cast the targets lungs fill with water and they cannot breath, they fall to the ground coughing and gagging. The effects of this spell depend on the narrative imperative and the whim of the GM. Either the target falls to the ground choking for 1d3+1 rounds, or the target dies, no save.
A circle of protection is a circle drawn upon the ground and infused with magical energy that breaks thaumaturgic contagion. As such it is hard for summoned creatures to cross, either in or out.
The circle can be marked using chalk, salt, enscribed in the floor or a multitude of other ways.

leveldescription.p: If successful Creates a DC25 protective barrier against extra planar creatures. Creatures striking the protective barrier will lose D4 hit points for each attempt.
If successful Creates a DC35 protective barrier against extra planar creatures. Creatures striking the protective barrier will lose D8 hit points for each attempt.

abilitydescription.p: The caster creates a magical shield around a person (or man-sized thing). The barrier from outside appears as a blurred humanoid shape. Kinetic weapons do half damage to the character thus shielded. It also provides brief protection from fires, poisoness gases . The shield is ablative and is represented ingame by temporary hit points.

The shield provides temporary hit points and lasts five minutes/30 rounds. If overcharged the shield may explode upon being hit, make a Std Check vs DDC 4 or explode. Explosions do 3d6 damage to all adjacent creatures including the character being shielded. Adjacent creatures may save, Speed vs DDC 10, to take half damage.
The caster shoots a raw stream of thaumic energy from their hands at a target. If successful the target may make a Dodge, agility, or speed check to avoid the stream.

If the stream hits the target the target suffers d6 damage and is pushed 30'10m away from the caster. If the caster hits and a benefit occurs roll on the overcharge effects table and apply the result to the target. The caster can choose whether or not to apply the overcharge effect to the target or to control the magical energies and supress the result.

The caster uses raw magical energy to knock a arrows and bolts out of the air. The caster must be aware of the attack, not ambushed or surprised. The size of the missile that can be diverted depends on the level of the casters ability. The missile does not have to be aimed at the caster in order for the caster to cast this spell. This spell is cast as a reaction after the target is hit, the caster can tell that the missile would hit and acts accordingly before it does.
The caster magically takes the appearance of a person, creature or thing. The glamour is illusiary in nature... a character taking the form of a great eagle cannot fly.

leveldescription.p: The caster may take the form of a person, creature of thing of similar size to the character. The difficulty of seeing through the glamour with True Sight is 15 DC.
The caster may take the form of a person, creature of thing of similar size to the character. The difficulty of seeing through the glamour with True Sight is 20 DC.
The caster may take the form of a person, creature of thing of significantly (50%) larger or smaller size to the character. The difficulty of seeing through the glamour with True Sight is 25.

abilitydescription.p: The caster grafts the fresh flesh of one creature onto another. Without the appropriate skeletal, vascular and muscular support the new flesh will not be usable by the subject, you can graft an extra arm to a subject but they will not be able to use it. You can however replace an existing limb with another or restore a previously amputated limb. Note that you cannot use this spell to replace a head on a creature. Once decapitated the creature is dead.

The healing character places their hands on a bloodied target and makes a check. If successful the bloodied character heals Health. On overcharge the healer accidentaly uses their own animus in order to heal the bloodied character. On overcharge the character may lose d6 hitpoints.
Incendo allows the caster to create fire by heating the air.

leveldescription.p: Creates a fire of torch intensity.
Allows the user to make a weapon flame for the duration of a combat. Flaming weapons do +d6 extra fire damage.

abilitydescription.p: The user creates a portal to another plane or to a different position on this plane. The portals remain open for 2d4 minutes.

leveldescription.p: The character can open a portal in a wall or floor.
Opens a portal between two well known places on this plane.
Opens a portal between this plane and a near plane (the shadow realms or the wylds).

abilitydescription.p: This is a very rapid invocation of the normal portal spell.

leveldescription.p: The character can open a portal in a wall or floor.
Opens a portal between two well known places on this plane.

abilitydescription.p: The caster uses magical energies to help him climb a surface as per the Climb ability.
This ability enables the user to recognize gateways, areas with an affinity with the Wyld. At these places the caster may cast a portal which opens to the Wyld.
It is not known how many such gateways exist. Given the near suicidal nature of travelling in the Wyld the knowledge of their locations is quickly forgotten.

Finally, it should be added that the Wyld is a many-varied place. Gateways can be found in swamps, deserts and sewers, as well as forested groves. Often the presence of a gateway is indicated by an incongrousness in the environment as the gateway forms a contagious link between the two planes at its locus. The nature of the Wyld bleeds into this plane at the gateway which can indicate the nature of the Wyld beyond.

Given an object with a contagious connection to a target, the caster summons a Phantasmal Leech to track the target. A Phantasmal Leech is a cat sized, snake-like demon with membraneous wings and a cyclostomatic head with five lidless black eyes. It is translucent, and insubstantial. The starving Leech craves the blood of the target and the caster sees through its eyes as it tracks the target. The leeches projection onto this plane is volatile and it is easily destroyed by magic. If not dismissed it will involuntarily return to its home plane after ten minutes. Furthermore the leech cannot interact with objects in this plane and may pass through walls, doors The leech cannot attack.

If successfully cast the target gets a perception check to notice the presence of the leech following. if the target has magical attacks these will almost certainly work against the leech, sending it back from whence it came. If the target has no magical attacks it cannot harm the creature.

tablerow.td: The caster summons a Phantasmal Vulture instead (as per the spell of the same name).
Something from beyond takes a small bite out of the caster. Caster suffers d6 health damage.
Something from beyond takes a big bite out of the caster. Caster suffers 3d6 health damage.
Weirdness ensues.. Reroll on the Overcharge Effects Table..

abilitylevel.effect: Target makes a perception check with DC 12.
Target makes a perception check with DC 14.

abilitydescription.p: Given an object with a contagious connection to a target, the caster summons a Phantasmal Vulture to track the target. A Phantasmal Vulture is a dog sized, vulture-like demon with membraneous wings, a tentacled face and stinging tail. Like a Phantasmal Leech it is translucent, susceptible to magical attacks and has the same difficulty of detection. Unlike the Leech the Vulture can summon its magical reserves to phase into this plane momentarilly to attack. It may attack once before being dispelled to its home plane and will automatically do so when it finds its prey (it is not up to the caster).
The vulture makes a single Std 2d8 + 2 attack versus AC for 1d8 damage (if the target has not perceived the vulture it is considered to be Blind to the attack, -4 to AC).

tablerow.td: Something from beyond takes a small bite out of the caster. Caster suffers d6 health damage.
Something from beyond takes a big bite out of the caster. Caster suffers 3d6 health damage.
Weirdness ensues.. Reroll on the Overcharge Effects Table..

abilitylevel.effect: Target makes a perception check with DC 12.
Target makes a perception check with DC 14.

abilitydescription.p: The character creates a cloak of darkness around themselves. This makes it very difficult to see the character at night time.
The character can view events from the past. Viewing events in the future is incredibly difficult and unreliable (See Scry, Greater).

The caster first names a target then checks to see whether the spell succeeds. If it does, they see an important scene from targets life (the GM narrates the scene to the player). The caster may then choose to look far forward, forward, back or far back in time. Each time the player attempts to view another scene from the targets life they make another check with their remaining magic pool against a DC 10. The caster may continue to view scenes from the targets life until they fail or choose to stop scrying.

Contagion is very important to this spell. A good contagious link, the targets blood, or hair for example, can reduce the difficulty of this spell by 10! If the caster fails any checks while scrying their contagious link is destroyed.

abilitylevel.effect: The caster views scences from the targets past.
The caster views scences from the targets past.

abilitydescription.p: The character can view events from a targets present and their future as well as their past. This spell works like the lesser Scry but because the future is not predetermined the results are often very unreliable and inaccurate.

abilitylevel.effect: The caster views scences from the targets past, present or future.
The caster views scences from the targets past, present or future

abilitydescription.p: When casting shatter the caster intones magical words and strikes a target of stone, metal or ice (in fact anything elemental in nature, even including wood).
This spell is particularly effective for bringing down structures supported be columns or arches. A city wall or a tower is designed to suffer a lot of damage without failing.

This spell may also be used to attack a subset of monsters, including earth and water elementals, metalic, stone or earthen constructs, and natural wooden animates. For most other creatures this spell does no damage.

abilitylevel.leveldescription: Against certain monsters roll to hit with a grounding weapon (staff or spear) and does an additional 4d10 damage.
Against certain monsters roll to hit with a grounding weapon (staff or spear) and does an additional 5d10 damage.

abilitydescription.p: The character opens a minute portal into one of the near planes. This allows some creature on the other side to project a simulacrum of themselves into this plane. It is highly likely that the entity will be ravenous and seek to devour the animus of the caster or others nearby. For this reason the caster usually also casts a circle of protection immediately after. For the caster to have control over the portal they must use a specially prepared fetish that is placed inside the circle before the summoning. The fetish provides a channel to the portal spell via an external plane, thereby circumventing the circle of protection.

If the caster does not commune with an entity before the summoning they may summon any extra planar creature. This can be incredibly dangerous. In addition demons may lie about their names and their capabailites. So the only, even moderately safe way of summoning demons is to: commune with a demon of a known name, then to summon them into a circle of protection. Note that demons are deceitful creatures and will jump at the chance to try to trick a summoner into calling them into the world and once here they will try to establish a foothold and not leave. They will try to break the circle of protection or bargain for information about the caster which will allow them to break the circle via contagion.

Closing the portal cuts the simulacrums link to the demon. Powerful demons may be able to keep the portal open themselves, once they have created a simulacrum. Note that the demons simulacrum need not look like the demon who created it and often times it does not as the demon will wish to disguise their identity.

abilitylevel.effect: A single demon enters the plane
A single demon enters the plane

abilitydescription.p: The Sign of Idreshein is a sigil that stores energy that can be released when something touches the sign.

abilitylevel.effect: 2d6 Thaumic damage to those near the blast
3d6 Thaumic damage to those near the blast

abilitydescription.p: Banishing is an attempt to disrupt a demons tenuous connection with its simulacrum. If the banisment succeeds the simulacrum is destroyed.

abilitylevel.check: Magic Pool vs Demons Magic Pool
Magic Pool + 5 vs Demons Magic Pool

abilitydescription.p: Commune is a spell that communicates with a named entity from beyond. The character must know the name of the entity to contact. On overcharge the character must make an opposed will check against the demon or become enthralled by the demon. Enthralled characters will seek to summon the demons simulacrum to this plane to further their nefarious plans.
Summoned demons are not compelled to cooperate with the character, nor tell the truth.

The caster attempts to insinutate an idea into the targets mind. In order to succeed the caster must first make a check to cast the spell and then at the point that the idea changes the targets normal behaviour the target must make a Willpower check against the characters magic pool result or behave in accordance with the mind worm. On overcharge the target realizes they are being compelled at the time the mind worm effects their behaviour. Other overcharge effects might also apply (for example the caster might create a two-way mind worm).

Bind holds an opponent using magical energies. The target makes a will check versus the spells difficulty and are held until they succeed. The difficulty decreases by two every round the target is held. The caster may release the target at any time.

abilitylevel.check: Magic Pool vs DDC 10 or opponents Willpower
Magic Pool + 2 vs DDC 10 or opponents Willpower

abilitydescription.p: The character gains a very enhanced sense of smell, temporarily. This spell gives them advantges to fighting when they cannot see (+2 to hit, more against strongly smelling opponents), +2 tracking, saves against illusions, +4 to Ambush roles, and +2 to Interogate and Perceive checks. The spell lasts half an hour.
The caster causes a fog to form by draining the temperature from the surrounds. If that's peculiar then people may notice something strange.
The targets skin takes on a greyish hue and hardens, providing some protection from physical damage.

Target breaks out in small pustules, loses something important to them, or some other annoying but not life threatening consequence. The caster must have at least one item of the targets: hair, blood etc.

Creates a weasel out of smoke that does what the caster asks of it. Dissipates after five minutes. The caster must have a source of smoke which they inhale and then breathe out in to their hands into something with the rough form of a weasel. The smoke weasel may be used to fetch things or carry small objects. The smoke weasel dissipates after a few minutes. On overcharge the smoke weasel is most likely to attack the caster.

The Flesh Ward spell provides magical protection for the caster against physical attacks, their skin knits itself up if they take damage. A Flesh Ward lasts the duration of combat and only one Flesh Ward can be in play at a time.

In game the effect of flesh ward is represented in the form of temporary hit points. If the caster succeeds they receive the stated number of temporary hit points (for the duration of the combat). If they overcharge then they suffer damage equal to the difference between the DC and their roll).
The character can converse with amphibian and reptile animals. Note however that these creatures are not that smart.
The character can converse with canine animals: bears, wolves, dogs and foxes.
The character can converse with ungulates: horses, goats, cows, deers, antelope, pigs, rhinoceroses, pigs, hipopotomai and the like.
The character can converse with cats and other felines.
The character can converse with birds. Note that birds are not very smart.
The character can converse with rodents: rats and mice etc.
The character holds death at bay for a moment. The target can reroll a single near-death roll. This spell may be cast once per character per day.

The character is able to discern the true nature of a being, seeing past glamours or other illusiary effects. This does not allow the character to discern motive or the content of a persons character.
Care should be taken because some creatures true form may be so hideous that it effects the observers sanity.
The character calls on their deity to repel beings animated by necrotic forces.

The caster grabs an opponent. On success the caster acts as a conduit to one of the dread planes, life is drained from the target. Anything that increases contagion will increase damage for this spell. The target is momentarily transfixed (checks Will versus the casters successful magic roll or loses their turn).

abilitylevel.effect: Target saves versus Willpower or suffers 2d8 damage. On overcharge the caster suffers 1d8 damage.
Target saves versus Willpower or suffers 3d8 damage. On overcharge the caster suffers 1d12 damage.
